content:
FALSE. While a 34.6-foot unicycle is prominently featured in circus performances, the official Guinness World Record for the tallest rideable unicycle is significantly higher[1].

## Official Guinness World Record

The current Guinness World Record for the "tallest rideable unicycle" is 13.405 meters (43 feet 11.75 inches)[1]. This record was achieved by Jamey Mossengren (USA) in Bemidji, Minnesota, on July 14, 2024[2].

Mossengren, known as "The Unicycling Unicorn," set the record during the Unicon 21 event, riding a unicycle reported to be 44 feet tall[4][5]. Although initial attempts during the opening ceremony were not successful, a practice run from earlier in the day where he completed the required distance was submitted to Guinness for verification[6]. The record-breaking ride required traveling a distance of at least 27 feet 10 inches; Mossengren reportedly rode for 36 feet 4.811 inches during his practice run[7].

## The 34.6-Foot Unicycle Claim

The 34.6-foot (10.55 meters) measurement is consistently associated with performer Wesley Williams, "The One Wheel Wonder," for the unicycle he rides in the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey circus[8][9][10]. Promotional materials and news reports frequently cite this height, with some stating Williams "breaks a record every day" during his performances[9][10][11][12]. However, this figure does not represent the current official Guinness World Record.

## Evolution of the Record

The record for the tallest rideable unicycle has been broken several times by various performers.

| Height | Record Holder | Date | Location | Source(s) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **3.08 m** (10 ft 1.26 in) | Mushegh Khachatryan | Sep 28, 2013 | Yerevan, Armenia | [13][14] |
| **6.0 m** (19.68 ft) | Mushegh Khachatryan | 2015 | N/A | [13] |
| **29 ft 1 in** (8.87 m) | Wesley Williams | Feb 2020 | N/A | [15][16] |
| **29.8 ft** | Pavel Valla Bertini | Jan 2022 | Budapest, Hungary | [17] |
| **31 ft 10 in** (9.71 m) | Wesley Williams | Dec 29, 2022 | Stuttgart, Germany | [18][19] |
| **34 ft 9 in** (10.6 m) | Wesley Williams | 2023 (reported) | N/A | [15] |
| **43 ft 11.75 in** (13.405 m) | Jamey Mossengren | Jul 14, 2024 | Bemidji, USA | [1][2] |

## Other Unicycle Record Categories

It is important to distinguish the "tallest rideable unicycle" record from other categories. For instance, Guinness World Records lists a separate record for the "tallest rideable unicycle (supported)," which was set by Sem Abrahams in 2004 at a height of 35 meters (114.8 feet)[20][21]. Additionally, some historical attempts, like Denis Frisoli's 35-foot "Tower of Death," were reportedly not recognized by Guinness due to safety concerns[22].
